definition: to stay/to stop over/to break one's journey
see 勾當|勾当[gou4 dang4]
surname Gou
to attract/to arouse/to tick/to strike out/to delineate/to collude/variant of 鉤|钩[gou1], hook
to leave (a message etc)/to retain/to stay/to remain/to keep/to preserve

sentences.english: You're traveling out of your way for us, I accept.
sentences.chinese: 我順便爲你們支配使你們在北京的勾留高興。

sentences.english: You're going out of your way for us, I believe.
sentences.chinese: 我順便爲你們安排使你們在中國的勾留愉快。

sentences.english: Please deliver the baggage to my hotel as soon as you've located it.
sentences.chinese: 一旦找到行李，請當即送到我勾留的飯館。

sentences.english: Did you stop anywhere on the way?
sentences.chinese: 途中你有在任何中央勾留嗎？

sentences.english: Youre traveling out of your way for us, dre beats, I accept.
sentences.chinese: 我順便爲你們安排使你們在北京的勾留高興。

sentences.english: You'll have about a three-hour layover before your connecting flight.
sentences.chinese: 您年夜約勾留三小時後，就能搭上轉接班機。

definition: place one has previously visited/old haunts
variant of 流連|流连[liu2 lian2]
to stay for a long period
to search for the right word (of poet)
tumbledown hovel/pauper's thatched hut
to live abroad/to be traveling/traveler
lit. boat made of lily magnolia wood/poetic term for boat
old traces/signs from the past
old variant of 覓|觅[mi4]
quiet, silent, and lonely/far and indistinct/gone without a trace
to stand for a long time/to wait/to look forward to/to accumulate
lit. clouds scatter, wind flows (idiom); the crisis settles down/people disperse home/things return to normal
romance/beautiful scenery/small or petty (of talk etc)
contacts/dealings
to live away from home temporarily
(literary) all day long
